New Records: Robert Williams and Jerami Grant each scored 19 points, leading the Portland Trail Blazers to a 122-108 win over the Minnesota Timberwolves.
Key Match Events: Portland jumped out to a 28-17 lead after the first quarter, capped off by a Dalano Banton 3-pointer at the buzzer.
The Blazers dominated the bench points in Tuesday night's game, outsourcing Minnesota 64-39.
Portland had two end of quarter buzzer-beating 3-pointers, one from Banton to end the first quarter and another from Deni Avdija to end the third quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: Donovan Clingan got the first start of his NBA career on Tuesday night in place of Deandre Ayton, who missed the game with a sprained finger.
Chris Finch blamed himself for Minnesota's loss to the Miami Heat on Sunday, saying he didn't have enough answers for the zone.
Post-Match Reflections: Robert Williams also had nine rebounds and three assists after recently returning from a knee injury.
The Blazers, who entered the game as the second-worst 3-point shooting team in the NBA, shot a blistering 18 for 32 (56%) from behind the 3-point line.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Naz Reid led Minnesota with 28 points in the loss while star guard Anthony Edwards pitched in 26 points.
The Blazers shot 56% from behind the 3-point line, improving their 3-point shooting significantly.
Others: Deandre Ayton missed the game with a sprained finger.
Sonny Smart, Kirby Smart's father, died Saturday of complications from hip surgery after falling in New Orleans ahead of the Sugar Bowl.
